intro: Marsdenia cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by follicles containing seeds. It is often found in forested areas and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
